results.title: Documenting Addicus
results.brief_description: An interactive work featuring the day-today experiences of Addicus, an eccentric and lonely young man, reflected both in moving image and in text through his diary.

results.title: Documentary: 1948 - 1976
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Herman J. Engel and Sonya Freidman
results.brief_description: Part three of a three part compilation history of the documentary film. This part presents films from 1948-1976. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary film style, content and construction. Before eac of the documentaries presented, there is an introduction that place the film historically.

results.title: Documentary of achievement
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the South African Iron and Steel Industrial Corporation. The film illustrates the growth of the vast iron and steel company and shows the part it has played in the development of South Africa through two generations in both peace and war. Contains excellent footage of construction of vehicles and ammunition for the war and some spectacular dangerous footage as well.

results.title: Documentary
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Herman J. Engel and Sonya Friedman
results.brief_description: A compilation film of major sequences from famous documentaries. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary style, content and construction. A brief introduction prior to each segment provides a historical context. This film is also available for loan in 3 parts: 1922-1939 (506297), 1935-1955 (506298), 1948-1976 (506299).

results.title: Doctors and nurses
results.creator_credit: Universal Entertainment, Finn Productions, Brian Rosen and Maurice Murphy
results.brief_description: Comedy in which roles are reversed in a children’s hospital so that the children are in control and diagnosing the problems of “childish” adults.

results.title: Doctor Zhivago
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Carlo Ponti and David Lean
results.brief_description: Doctor Zhivago is a moving story of love and romance told against the flaming background of the Russian Revolution. The story is presented through many characters whose destinies are interwoven. Not only is it a vast panorama of a country undergoing the most radical revolution in history; it also probes, with deep and desperate concern, the personal struggle of one man’s survival. The film stars Omar Sharif and Julie Christie. A poet, a surgeon, a husband and a lover - this is the story of Zhivago. Based on the novel by Boris Pasternak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Carlo Ponti and David Lean

results.title: Doctor woman: life and times of Elizabeth Bagshaw
results.creator_credit: Lockwood Films, Beryl Fox and Mark McCurdy
results.brief_description: A forerunner of the women’s movement, Elizabeth Bagshaw was one of the first women to practice medicine in Canada. In having to overcome society’s bias against women in medicine she helped to instigate changes in public opinion on that issue as well as the issue of birth control. The film captures the personality of this remarkable woman through a contemporary interview and re-enactments of episodes from her youth. The sepia tones of the re-enactments are in keeping with the film techniques of the time, giving the viewer a strong sense of the period. The film is of special interest to people interested in the evolution of woman’s roles in Canadian society. (Awards: Toronto; Columbus)

results.title: Doctor Who: time flight
results.brief_description: Peter Davison, as the fifth Dr. Who, and his two female companions Tegan and Nyssa are mourning the loss of their other companion, Adric. The Doctor decides to travel in time to 1851 on planet earth to visit the Great Exhibition in London - to take their minds off things. However, as any keen fan would know, where the Doctor wants to go is not necessarily where the Tardis will take him. Instead they land in the 1980s at Heathrow airport. His arrival coincides with a missing Concorde aircraft and the doctor is drawn into the investigation by his friends at U.N.I.T. - his solution is to fly another Concorde on the exact same flight plan to find out what happened. With the Tardis aboard the aircraft they land on what appears to be Heathrow - but isn’t. An evil being is controlling the disappearances and using his captives - but why? And what for?
